channel.title: Memory Editing Plugin
channel.description:
WARNING: Use only if you know what you're doing.
Someone (might have been mopar) asked about memory functions in SCAR, and I had a plugin I started on a while back, so here it is a little cleaned up. Currently it only supports reading/writing dword values. Anything bigger, I might add later, but having write support makes it better than ACTool already.
[b]WriteDword(processID,offset,value)[/b] - writes the specified value to the offset in <processID>'s memory space [b]ReadDword(processID,offset)[/b] - reads a value at offset [b]GetWindowProcessID(windowhandle)[/b] - returns the process ID associated with the window
[URL=http://img177.imageshack.us/my.php?image=memoryplugin3pg.png][IMG]http://img177.imageshack.us/img177/5986/memoryplugin3pg.th.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: Memory Editing Plugin
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Iamadam:

Do you think I could use this to help interface between a java client and SCAR? (It’s a pain learning JNI)

No, this is really meant for SCAR + other games. If you want to make a hybrid bot then ask RegeX for the source to his shared memory map thing, which is definitely my favorite way that I’ve seen it done (basically gives you a SendInterSCARMessage on the Java side). I don’t know what xSCAR used, but it seems to have legions of devoted followers in spite of the fact that it died withing 3 days of release, kaitnieks.com collapsed, and semaphore quit. So it must have done something right?

Read full topic

Someone (might have been mopar) asked about memory functions in SCAR, and I had a plugin I started on a while back, so here it is a little cleaned up. Currently it only supports reading/writing dword values. Anything bigger, I might add later, but having write support makes it better than ACTool already.

WriteDword(processID,offset,value) - writes the specified value to the offset in 's memory space
ReadDword(processID,offset) - reads a value at offset
GetWindowProcessID(windowhandle) - returns the process ID associated with the window
